intro: Luzama mataxa, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant features dark green, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its fruit is a round, fleshy berry that turns red when ripe, containing several seeds. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically consumed by humans or livestock.
